snippet: To the Editor:    Re the fraud case against a California man who is accused of helping students cheat on standardized exams for graduate school (front page, Oct. 29):    Last year someone offered me $2,000 to take the Graduate Management Admission...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re the fraud case against a California man who is accused of helping students cheat on standardized exams for graduate school (front page, Oct. 29): Last year someone offered me $2,000 to take the Graduate Management Admissions Test for him. I explained that I couldn't do it and that, anyway, Educational Testing Service checks identification fairly closely. He replied that lots of people he knew had done it and that fake ID's are easy to get.
abstract: Willys Chip Terry letter responds to Oct 29 article on fraud case against California man accused of helping students cheat on standardized exams for graduate school

headline.main: Those 'Objective' Tests Still Benefit the Rich
